qas.question: Which official name was Russia given at the start of 1918?

context: On January 25, 1918, at the <a4_0><b13_0>third<b13_0/><a4_0/> meeting of the All-Russian Congress of Soviets, the unrecognized state was renamed <a0_0><a5_0>the <b9_0>Soviet Russian Republic<b9_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>. On March 3, 1918, <a2_0>the <b11_0>Treaty of Brest-Litovsk<b11_0/><a2_0/> was signed, giving away much of the land of the former Russian Empire to <a1_0><b10_0>Germany<b10_0/><a1_0/>, in exchange for <a6_0>peace in World War I<a6_0/>. On <a7_0>July 10, 1918<a7_0/>, the Russian Constitution of 1918 renamed the country the Russian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic. By 1918, during <a3_0><a8_0>the <b12_0>Russian Civil War<b12_0/><a8_0/><a3_0/>, several states within the former Russian Empire had seceded, reducing the size of the country even more.
